title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:10 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
00:13 <abusenius> has quit  
00:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:42 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
00:45 <vmassol> has quit  
00:51 <xenon75> has quit  
00:57 <pturcotte> has quit  
01:21 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
01:21 <Denis> has quit  
01:38 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
02:31 <Enygma`> has quit  
03:19 <DrLou> has quit  
03:20 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
03:21 <DrLou> has quit  
03:57 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: do I need mvn 3 to build platform locally ?  
03:59 <+sburjan`> Error resolving version for 'org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-site-plugin': Plugin requires Maven version 3.0  
03:59 <cjdelisle> Yes, we are using maven3  
04:00 <cjdelisle> there was a possibility that it still worked in maven2 but no guarantee and it looks like you proved that it does not.  
04:01 <+sburjan`> I can't guarantee I have everything set ok, but it seems I need mvn3... even if the documentation states that I need minimm maven 2.2.1  
04:02 <+sburjan`> I guess there is no artefact difference, only the waydependencies are resolved and modules built, right ?  
04:02 <cjdelisle> Hmm, if it says that you need maven 2.2.1, that sounds wrong  
04:02 <cjdelisle> I think the 3.0 is the minimum  
04:03 <+sburjan`> I am reading here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
04:05 <+sburjan`> I will install mvn3 and try again. but for now, sleep mode :) mighty night  
04:05 <cjdelisle> gnight  
04:07 <+sburjan`> that page will need serious reviews  
04:07 <+sburjan`> Install Maven 3.0 or greater. Create an M2\_HOME environment variable pointing to where you have installed Maven. Add M2\_HOME/bin to your PATH environment variable.  
04:08 <cjdelisle> yea, m2 is maven > 1.x  
04:08 <cjdelisle> maven2 was so different from maven1 that it was rebranded  
04:09 <cjdelisle> maven3 is internally different but the interface is still about the same  
04:09 <+sburjan`> so stil .m2 in you homedir ?  
04:09 <+sburjan`> \*still  
04:09 <+sburjan`> not .m3 ?  
04:09 <cjdelisle> yea ~/.m2/ is still the maven dir  
04:10 <+sburjan`> I see. I never had installed mvn3 :)  
04:10 <cjdelisle> When I release a software project, the first release will be 1 and then 2 then 3 then 4  
04:10 <cjdelisle> this x.x.xx-x stuff is too complicated  
04:11 <+sburjan`> I agree  
07:00 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis1> has quit  
07:47 <sdumitriu> has quit  
08:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <vmassol> good morning  
08:32 <vmassol> XWiki Rendering is now on Maven Central!  
08:32 <vmassol> :)  
08:32 <cjdelisle> nice  
08:32 <cjdelisle> maven 3.0 is the minimum build version correct?  
08:33 <vmassol> for what?  
08:33 <vmassol> cjdelisle: thanks for myxwiki. Any issue you've had?  
08:34 <vmassol> cjdelisle: there are some copy pastes on http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/UpgradesLog check the first 3 lines ;)  
08:34 <cjdelisle> for building platform, and yes I had plenty of little issues like installing the wrong version of the XAR but I think everything is corrected now.  
08:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: for building platform, let me see what we put in the doc… indeed 3.0: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
08:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok great for myxwiki, if the only issue was a wrong version of the xar then it's all good :)  
08:36 <cjdelisle> I edited it because sburjan` said that 2.0 wasn't working and I checked the build machine and it is running 3.0  
08:36 <cjdelisle> what is the page which needs to be edited to make a header display telling admins to upgrade?  
08:38 <vmassol> ah :)  
08:38 <vmassol> thought we had it set for some time already  
08:38 <vmassol> yes 3.0 is ok as the minimal req  
08:39 <vmassol> cjdelisle: it's step 18 on http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Upgrading  
08:40 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I'll let you fix the copy/paste on http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/UpgradesLog  
08:40 <cjdelisle> ahh thankyou  
08:40 <vmassol> got to go for an early run, bb in 1 hour  
08:40 <cjdelisle> I'm heading to bed soon  
08:40 <vmassol> ok nn and thanks again for the myxwiki upgrade! :)  
08:40 <cjdelisle> if you happen to discover anything else, let me know and I'll get it fixed ASAP  
09:13 <Stulle|Notebook> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <Stulle|Notebook> has quit  
09:25 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <+sburjan`> cjdelisle\; thanks :)  
11:25 <Denis> has quit  
11:38 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <abusenius> has quit  
12:00 <rrodriguez> has quit  
12:48 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <mflorea> has quit  
16:40 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
16:51 <rrodriguez> has quit  
17:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <rrodriguez> has quit  
17:34 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
19:32 <+sburjan`> cjdelisle, sdumitriu : around ?  
19:32 <@sdumitriu> Me yes  
19:36 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: how can I checkout the origin repo from my fork on local disk ?  
19:37 <+sburjan`> I am synced with my repo, but I am not synced with origin  
19:37 <+sburjan`> I always forget that command  
19:39 <@sdumitriu> git pull origin  
19:39 <@sdumitriu> git pull origin --rebase  
19:43 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: already up to date  
19:43 <+sburjan`> git push: everything up to date  
19:43 <+sburjan`> but my fork is not synced with xwiki  
19:43 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure?  
19:43 <+sburjan`> https://github.com/sorinello/xwiki-enterprise  
19:45 <@sdumitriu> Try now  
19:46 <@sdumitriu> pull + push  
19:47 <+sburjan`> same  
19:48 <+sburjan`> what am I missing... hmmmm  
19:49 <+sburjan`> I cloned from my repo, si O couldn't have latest xwiki/xwiki-platform  
19:52 <+sburjan`> \*so I  
19:59 <+sburjan`> From github.comorinello/xwiki-enterprise  
19:59 <+sburjan`> = [up to date] master -> origin/master  
19:59 <+sburjan`> = [up to date] xwiki-2.7 -> origin/xwiki-2.7  
19:59 <+sburjan`> = [up to date] xwiki-3.0 -> origin/xwiki-3.0  
19:59 <+sburjan`> = [up to date] xwiki-3.1M1 -> origin/xwiki-3.1M1  
19:59 <+sburjan`> Already up-to-date.  
19:59 <+sburjan`> it seems that pull takes from my fork, not from origin  
20:07 <+sburjan`> so I guess there is something the way I created my repo, right ?  
20:17 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: any idea ?  
20:19 <@sdumitriu> Not origin, upstream  
20:19 <@sdumitriu> Origin is your fork  
20:19 <+sburjan`> oh  
20:19 <+sburjan`> upstream does not appear to be a git repository  
20:20 <@sdumitriu> git remote  
20:20 <+sburjan`> I get origin  
20:21 <@sdumitriu> git remote add upstream git://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise.git  
20:23 <+sburjan`> ok, worked  
20:24 <+sburjan`> odd, at the other computer I didn't have to add these, I wonder what changed  
20:25 <@sdumitriu> You must have had them already  
20:25 <+sburjan`> from twhere ?  
20:25 <+sburjan`> AFAIK cloning my fork would also add the upstream main official repo  
20:25 <+sburjan`> afaik on the computer from work upstream is called official  
20:30 <@sdumitriu> No, it doesn't add upstream  
20:30 <@sdumitriu> "official" I added that one last time I was in Ia?i  
20:30 <+sburjan`> on my machine ?  
20:31 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
20:31 <+sburjan`> wow, elephant memory :)  
20:31 <+sburjan`> and I always though that git was 100% setup by me :))  
20:33 <+sburjan`> ok, ow next question  
20:33 <+sburjan`> this is a hard one I guess.. because you're using Gentoo  
20:33 <+sburjan`> I tried to build platform using mvn2 conforming to documentation page  
20:33 <+sburjan`> caleb fixed it .. to maven 3 as a requirement  
20:34 <+sburjan`> not it seems mvn3 is not in my universe repo on ubuntu.. so I guess I have to install it manually  
20:34 <+sburjan`> you recomment completely uninstalling mvn2, right ?  
20:34 <+sburjan`> actually I am interested if I can build a mvn2 project unsing mvn3 . is it backward ?  
20:34 <@sdumitriu> It would be safer, since it's less probable to end up using the wrong version  
20:34 <@sdumitriu> Yes it is  
20:35 <+sburjan`> thanks.. I am also starting my dissertation project, and those tools still need maven 2  
20:41 <@sdumitriu> Hehe, I have both installed, and switching between them is as simple as  
20:41 <@sdumitriu> eselect maven set mvn-2.2  
20:44 <+sburjan`> I guess that's Gentoo Power :D  
21:45 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
22:41 <rrodriguez> has quit  
23:25 <vmassol> has quit  
23:47 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
23:50 <rrodriguez> has quit
